results.title: Our peninsula
results.brief_description: A personal narrative by Jenny Macaffer about her family’s relationship with the Mornington Peninsula over three generations using photographic images and computer animation. Pipe music performed by the Rats of Tobruk Memorial Highland Band 1984.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.

results.title: Leaving Tropeoulhos
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Anastasia Solomidis
results.brief_description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.

results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.

results.title: Op shops of our town
results.brief_description: An amusing ‘mockumentary’ on several of the Op Shops in the East Gippsland region. This tongue-in-cheek journey introduces us to the eccentricities of op-shopping, the people who run them, the people who shop in them, and the eclectic mix of goods found in them. Stars Mr Kearney and Ms Jennian, with thanks to the following participating Op Shops - Paynesville Op Shop and Uniting Church, Lakes Entrance Ambulance, Salvos and St Vincents in Bairnsdale. Music from the fabulous Stereophonic Optigan, written and played by Mr Kearney. Camera - Jeremy Johnson.

results.title: Mallee blossom
results.brief_description: This is Maureen Barry’s story of her life as a farmer, wife, mother and rural nurse in the dusty bowl of the Mallee in outback Victoria. She tells of the hardships and isolation, but also of the gradual blossoming of the land as both she and her husband keep pace with technology, embracing sustainable farming practices so as to leave the land in a better state for those who follow. This story is part of a project funded by VicHealth and partnership with the women’s rural network, Partners in Grain.

group.title: Against the grain: digital storytelling project

results.title: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission
results.brief_description: This is a documentary film about growing up on Lake Condah Aboriginal Mission. A local Elder, Uncle Kenny Saunders, visits the site of Lake Condah Mission and talks about his childhood memories revealing a past of cruelty and fear, and the devastation felt in the aftermath of the Eumerella massacres.
